intro: Afrorhaphidophora africana, commonly known as the African leafy spurge, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
